fields.description:
Possibly Jason is doing/has done this as a part of "run button improvements". Or maybe not.

steps to repro:
1) create a plan that contain two stages. Second stage let be manual stage.
2) run that plan, don't run the manual stage.
3) modify first stage's job to run script task "sleep 1d".
4) run that plan (#2 time)
5) while it is running go to build no #1 and click on 'continue stage' button (on the left navigator).
6) you will be shown the error as in attachment (assuming you have concurrent builds set to 1, or none at all)
6a) where I had expected there will be some links to either CAC documentation ("what is the concurrent builds? how can I change it?"), or either to concurrent build configurations (see BDEV-626 for the urls).

----

What's the problem with the above message (real story from Gdansk office jira devs):
If the user is a developer that doesn't have wide knowledge of Bamboo he might encounter this message when trying to 'deploy' one of his manual stages that had finished in the past. And if the plan is running that developer has no idea what we're trying to tell him ("what concurrent builds, I see some red error, get me out!").
fields.summary: The "you have reached the maximum number of concurrent builds allowed" message should link to configuration/docs.

fields.description:
* http://localhost:8085/bamboo/admin/viewConcurrentBuildConfig.action
* http://localhost:8085/bamboo/chain/admin/config/editChainMiscellaneous.action?buildKey=PROJ-PLAN
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Configuring+concurrent+builds

So the user won't need to google what is the 'concurrent build limit in Bamboo' and how to set it, but go directly there.

Not that I think this is the most critical issue - just a small improvement.
fields.summary: in "Plan cannot currently be run because you have reached your concurrent build limit" add link to configuration page.

Dropbox --> Bamboo-ux --> BDEV-1416 - run customized stage

fields.description:
We want to make 'setting up a filter' look as easy and painless as possible, while at the same time downplay the importance of Labels. Therefore, we have decided to hide the option for using Labels in the filter, but users can easily get there within the modal dialog box. The prototype shows this clearly:

Dropbox --> bamboo-ux --> BDEV-1428 - filter button dialog - no labels --> index.html

I have also changed the flowchart to reflect the change. But quickly in words:
If users decide to show the labels and set them, and then at some point collapse it again, it deletes any selections they have made beforehand. Reason is that we want to make sure users have no doubt that when they hide the labels, they are no longer filtering anything. However, if users open the labels and filter with them, then press "Save and apply", the next time they open the modal dialog, they once again encounter the label options expanded and still selected. Any questions to me, please.
fields.summary: Dashboard filter - Hide Labels filter option initially

fields.description:
Currently, you can obtain following IM notification (triggered by "after x failed" strategy)

{code}
+core+ Bamboo > OpenJDK7 CI Tests > #1949 has failed (2 times).
 ---------------------------------
Scheduled 
1/2 jobs failed, with 1 failing test.
{code}

Notice there is no full-stop after _Scheduled_ part. The _Scheduled_ part comes from the _triggerReasonDescription_ macro (check our .ftl's for it). Now, question is, whether such formatting in this particular scenario is OK, and whether all combinations of triggerReasonDescriptions + notifications formatting looks correctly. As we changed the trigger reason text for our UI recently, maybe we'd forgot to review all our notifications?

anyway, for the origins of this issue, see [Brydie's crucible comment|https://atlaseye.atlassian.com/cru/CR-BAM-4798#c91400]
fields.summary: Review the text used in notifications. Start with example in the description.

fields.description:
When expanding or collapsing test failures, it takes an incredibly long time if you have more than, say, 10 test failures.

It seems that this is because the expand/collapse buttons are iterating through each DOM element and manually triggering a click on each and every one of them in sequence.

The attached screenshot demonstrates the significance of this problem in Chrome with 50 test failures. It takes Chrome about 1.2 seconds with 50 tests. This gets progressively worse with more tests. It causes IE8 have a heart attack. Poor IE8.

Can we make this... faster?
fields.summary: Performance of expand/collapse test failures is quite slow

fields.description:
Using Mercurial as a repository and branched building, a commit to close a branch should not cause the closed branch to have mainline changes merged in.

Example:
{{branch}} is created off of {{default}}
{{branch}} has changes committed and pushed
Bamboo detects new branch and builds
{{default}} has changes and is pushed
{{branch}} is merged to {{default}}, closed and pushed

In this instance, Bamboo will merge the changes in default back into {{branch}} even though it is closed.

Instead, Bamboo should just close the build branch without merging the changes from {{default}} first
fields.summary: Do Not Automatically Merge to Closed Branch

fields.description: When a job is triggered by some means e.g "Single Daily Build" with some changes done by a particular user, then the build summary captures the user that affected the change and this is represented correctly in the activity stream of JIRA. However, if the same job is rebuild, the author name is replaced with the number of times and this caused the users name to be replaced with "anonymous user". I will attach some screenshot to depict the behaviour.
fields.summary: Build Author`s name replaced with anonymous user when a triggered job is rebuild

fields.description:
We have a plan where my default trigger is based on "Polling the Repository for changes" scheduled at 1.00am to make nightly builds only if there are changes in the repository. Automatic branching is enabled, so every time a new branch is created it is automatically built instead of waiting until 1.00am.

This behavior becomes a problem since our build time is very long and we create branches very often, so our build agents are always busy and cannot attend urgent demands. It would be nice to launch the first build of a newly created branch only when the default trigger is triggered.
fields.summary: Do not launch first build automatically when default trigger is "Polling repository for changes" scheduled at certain time

fields.description:
If the Jenkins importer is run a second time we need a clean way to resolve duplicates or overwrite the previously imported plans.

The prototype of the solution can be found at:
Dropbox/bamboo-ux/4.4 M1 - jenkins importer/prototype/index.html

Click on the "Re-import with errors" page link on the left.

The prototype is pretty self-explanatory. The colors used are ADG-approved derivatives of main colors and can be used. 

Click on one of the "How to resolve" links to see how users can resolve their problem.

Any questions, please contact Matty.
fields.summary: If importing for a second time we need a way to resolve duplicates

fields.description: Presently the create issue from Bamboo allows users to field in values for certain fields with issue type and summary as mandatory. There are instances whereby some other fields or custom fields are required in JIRA. In such a case, the issue creation will fail. It will be nice if Bamboo could identify those fields and prompt for values.
fields.summary: Allow users to add extra configurable fields when creating issues from Bamboo

fields.description:
In the situation where there is only one agent (which matches all capabilities and requirements of all plans), Bamboo will randomly pick a stage from all currently queued plans to run. For example,
# Plan A: Stage 1
# Plan B: Stage 1
# Plan B: Stage 2
# Plan A: Stage 2
# Plan A: Stage 3

This is unintuitive behaviour. Bamboo should commit to FIFO ordering for plan stages in this situation.
fields.summary: Queue for plan stages with one agent is not FIFO

fields.description:
AOD has a feature to [transition issues through a workflow according to build results|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Integrating+Builds+with+your+Issues+Workflow].

JIRA is notified of build results via a notification subscription set up in the Bamboo OnDemand upgrade task [UpgradeTo_v1|https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/bamboo/src/4c6fff87401eacb3bbf6f09a4f240b1e45407818/bamboo-ondemand-project/studio-theme-bamboo-plugin/src/main/java/com/atlassian/studio/bamboo/upgrade/UpgradeTo_v1.java?at=default#cl-139]. The code in JIRA that handles the notification is in [BambooBuildNotificationsServlet|https://stash.atlassian.com/projects/JIRA/repos/jira/browse/jira-ondemand-project/jira-ondemand-plugins/jira-ondemand-theme-plugin/src/main/java/com/atlassian/studio/jira/workflow/BambooBuildNotificationsServlet.java].

When JIRA recieves a notification, the workflow transition is skipped because userUtil.getUser(commit.getAuthor()) returns null. This is supposed to return the user who is the author of the commit, and is used as the "logged in user" who applies the workflow transition in JIRA. See [BambooBuildNotificationsServlet.java#150|https://stash.atlassian.com/projects/JIRA/repos/jira/browse/jira-ondemand-project/jira-ondemand-plugins/jira-ondemand-theme-plugin/src/main/java/com/atlassian/studio/jira/workflow/BambooBuildNotificationsServlet.java#150].
The problem is that commit.getAuthor() returns the full user name of the committer (e.g. "Robin Fernandes"), whereas {{userUtilImpl.getUser()} expects the short username of the user (e.g. "rfernandes").

As far as I can tell, the short username is not in the XML data posted from Bamboo to the JIRA servlet, so I suspect something will need to change on the Bamboo side to convey the required information.

This was originally identified in support case https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JST-53379.
fields.summary: Build result notifications fail to transition JIRA issues to Resolved or Build Broken status in AOD

fields.description:
To make it easier to find errors in the logfiles, it would be nice to colorize lines.

for example, every line with the text 'error' should be red and bold
every line with 'warning' should be yellow.

Better if this would be somehow configurable (so if you use a tool in different language)

fields.description:
When running a NAnt build task on the Stock Bamboo Windows image, the following error occurs:

{noformat}
log4net:ERROR XmlConfiguratorAttribute: Exception getting ConfigurationFileLocation. Must be able to resolve ConfigurationFileLocation when ConfigFile and ConfigFileExtension properties are not set.
System.Security.SecurityException: Request for the permission of type 'System.Security.Permissions.FileIOPermission, mscorlib, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b77a5c561934e089' failed.
at System.Security.CodeAccessSecurityEngine.Check(Object demand, StackCrawlMark& stackMark, Boolean isPermSet)
at System.Security.CodeAccessSecurityEngine.Check(CodeAccessPermission cap, StackCrawlMark& stackMark)
at System.Security.CodeAccessPermission.Demand()
at System.AppDomainSetup.VerifyDir(String dir, Boolean normalize)
at log4net.Util.SystemInfo.get_ConfigurationFileLocation()
at log4net.Config.XmlConfiguratorAttribute.ConfigureFromFile(Assembly sourceAssembly, ILoggerRepository targetRepository)
The action that failed was:
Demand
The type of the first permission that failed was:
System.Security.Permissions.FileIOPermission
The Zone of the assembly that failed was:
Internet
{noformat}

This is caused by Nant not being unblocked prior to being unpacked. [See this stack Overflow past|http://stackoverflow.com/questions/8605122/how-do-i-resolve-configuration-errors-with-nant-0-91].

The Stock Windows image needs this applied so that users can run Nant builds without making their own AMI.

fields.description:
When a project is deleted in OnDemand, it'll delete the corresponding Confluence/FishEye/Bamboo project, but it seems that in the case of Bamboo the project still hangs around (the plans are removed though).

I don't think this causes any problems, but it does cause customer confusion - a customer raised a support request about the supposedly deleted projects still showing in the "Remove Plans" page in Bamboo admin.

*Workaround:*

send a {{DELETE}} to {{example.atlassian.net/builds/plugins/servlet/studio/project?key=FOO}} where FOO is the project key.

If that failed, try to send a {{DELETE}} to {{example.atlassian.net/builds/rest/capabilities/aggregate-root/bamboo.project/FOO}}.
fields.summary: Bamboo project not being deleted in OnDemand when corresponding JIRA project is deleted

fields.description:
One of the differences between archives is that the Java heap uses different option names: 
[http://www.atlassian.com/software/bamboo/downloads/binary/atlassian-bamboo-4.3.3.zip]
{code}
# Initial Java Heap Size (in MB)
wrapper.java.initmemory=256

# Maximum Java Heap Size (in MB)
wrapper.java.maxmemory=512
{code}

[http://www.atlassian.com/software/bamboo/downloads/binary/atlassian-bamboo-4.3.3.tgz]
{code}
wrapper.java.additional.3=-Xms256m
wrapper.java.additional.4=-Xmx512m
{code}

Please use the same configuration options in all provided packages to have consistency and avoid confusions.
fields.summary: Change BAMBOO_INSTALL/conf/wrapper.conf file to have consistency between all Bamboo packages

fields.description:
The Windows AMIs for Elastic Bamboo should include the Amazon EC2 command line tools. Without these tools it's impossible to scrip the mounting of EBS volumes/snapshots etc.
This will also require the the ability to upload the EC2 private key and certificate.

http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonEC2/gsg/2006-06-26/setting-up-your-tools.html
fields.summary: Add EC2 tools to the Elastic Bamboo Windows AMIs

fields.description:
Perforce stores a configuration file on the p4 server which defines where the checkout occurs. When we "let bamboo manager to manage our workspace" we update that config file on the server, setting the checkout location to the regular agent/job build location.

We have concurrency issues when multiple agents are trying to update that config file. We should add some synchronization to disallow such situation, where two agents are trying to work on the same p4 server config file.

It needs to work with remote agents and be reliable - i.e. it should work even if the agent goes down while it's locking the config file.
fields.summary: Provide synchronization for multiple agents trying to checkout the same Perforce workspace

fields.description: As per subject and we if deploy the data to another instance or perform upgrade with the export generated, the artifacts will be lost.
fields.summary: Artifacts are not exported even if "Export Artifacts" is checked while doing Eport or running Scheduled Backups

fields.description:
I'm not sure how many people can find this confusing, but I personally believe that the multiple-line select is not really intuitive or easy to use. 
It's difficult to find your alias, to discover which ones you selected and to make mistakes and unselect stuff you didn't want to. 


I would recommend to change it to a component like this one:
http://code.google.com/p/jquery-ui-picklist/
fields.summary: 'Source Repository Alias' pick list interface

fields.description:
Presently with the branch updater merging strategy, commits to master don`t trigger branches and as a result there is no auto trigger on the branches. It will be a good option to have such a feature.

*Workaround*
1. Create a new repository that points to the same master branch and set up that second master repository to trigger all the branches. I will attach screenshots to illustrate.
2. Create a separate plan for the feature branch and set up build dependency
fields.summary: Add the functionality to trigger a build of the feature branch upon change in the master if auto-merging is applied

fields.description: I have a plan with several stages, one if them is a manual stage with no jobs. Whenever the plan runs (manually or scheduled) the build correctly halts on said manual stage. However, when I rerun the build (or rerun failed/incomplete jobs only), the manual stage and all stages after that are executed regardless.
fields.summary: Rerunning build with jobless manual stage will not stop on that stage.
Add a Global READ permission for all plans

fields.description: Currently, the Issues tab in build results summary shows the issue key, description and status which are static based on REST API call to the JIRA issue, so whenever there is a change in the issue status, this is taken effect in Bamboo after a refresh of the page thus loosing the original status of the issue. It will be nice if we can retrieve the history of the issue status starting from the build time.
fields.summary: Collect history of issue`s status linked to a Bamboo build

fields.description:

And I have a very similar problem with my javascript test that use grunt.
fields.summary: There should be a category for custom tests.

fields.description:
Issue in the tip of default=, 19-Dec.

h2. Repro Steps

# Get a large data set, so there's actually some stuff to expire (eg. CBAC data)
# Kick off BuildExpiry in the background
# Wait a little bit, branch detection kicks in
# App hangs (no requests processed)

h2. Analysis

There seems to be a deadlock between our various flavours of plan caches. It's getting pretty convoluted to be honest...

In the plan cache space:

* ImmutablePlanCacheService
* ImmutablePlanManager
* DashboardCachingManager

and  various ways to invalidate...

* CacheInvalidationInterceptor
* PlanConfigurationAspect
* DashboardCacheListener

It looks like it's some hilarious interactions between these things to cause it to die. In the dump below, the interesting looking threads:

* QuartzScheduler_Worker-9 -> Exiring, updating dashboard cache, locking on pre-get flush
* QuartzScheduler_Worker-7 -> Branch detection

fields.description:
Batches are no longer cached after generation due to the following commit in atlassian-plugins-webresource
{noformat}
commit c988d9b8d9b30e44799051150dc8c8c8db87748e

    Pass the HASH part of /s/HASH/_/blah urls as a "_statichash" param to DownloadableResource.
    PluginResourceDownload assumes that "_statichash" may be a request attribute, and copies it into the params if necessary.
    Apps using urlrewrite.xml can add _statichash as a request attribute quite easily.
    
            <set name="_statichash">$1</set>
    
    e.g.:
    
       <rule>
            <from>^/s/(.*)/_/(.*)</from>
            <run class="com.atlassian.plugin.servlet.ResourceDownloadUtils" method="addCachingHeaders" />
            <to type="forward">/$2</to>
            <set name="_statichash">$1</set>
        </rule>
{noformat}
fields.summary: Batches are regenerated upon every request

fields.description:
The Bamboo Clover Plugin is using an XPath expression in order to fetch some basic data from clover.xml report. Using XPath can consume a lot of memory/cpu in case when XML file is large and this might be a problem as report is being parsed on Bamboo side (so in case of OnDemand it will be on our instance and not on the Amazon EC2 instance). As Clover support for OnDemand will be officially started very soon, this fix should be done ASAP.

XPath could be easily replaced by the simple SAX handler. Source to be fixed:

components\bamboo-plugins\bamboo-plugin-clover\src\main\java\com\atlassian\bamboo\builder\coverage\CloverReportParser.java
fields.summary: Replace XPath queries by pure SAX handler in Clover Plugin

fields.description: Let's say you want to use a specific SSH executable instead of the default one for Git clone. As you see in the attached screenshot, you can achieve that by using a Git capability, and then choose the needed SSH executable. If you need to pass parameters to your SSH executable, you can point from there to a bat file (or to a script file) that contains a path to your SSH executable with the needed parameters. For example, you can point to a script file that contains something like: /path_to_my_ssh_executable/my_ssh.bat -S -r
fields.summary: Document the feature for custom Git SSH executable

fields.description:
*steps to reproduce*
# Create a task that produces an artifact
# Create an scp task to copy over the artifact from step 1 to a remote server
# Ensured that directory permissions are respected on the remote server
# The build runs successfully with no error but fails to copy over the file

*Tested version*
Bamboo 4.3.1 with plugin version 1.14 {color:green}OK{color}
Bamboo 4.3.3 with plugin version 1.15 {color:red}Failed{color}

I am attaching screenshot of the build log showing the difference between the two test. It therefore seems to be related to the plugin version

*Workaround*
Replace the version of the SCP plugin wih version 1.14 as thus:
# Shutdown Bamboo
# Download version 1.14 of the plugin from this [page|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.bamboo.plugins.bamboo-scp-plugin] and copy it over to $HOME/plugins directory
# Delete the HOME/bundled-plugins folder
# Remove the bamboo-scp-plugin-1.16.jar file from the {{$INSTALL\webapp\WEB-INF\classes\atlassian-bundled-plugins.zip}} folder
# Restart bamboo
fields.summary: SCP task plugin does not copy over files to remote server in Bamboo 4.3.3

fields.description:
Hi,

A previously working feature of the Bitbucket source repository integration in Bamboo OnDemand was that I could not only select repos that I own myself but also the ones that I follow or the team-repos that I'm a member of. It seems that this is no longer the case and the only repositories I can select from the drop-down are the ones I created myself in Bitbucket. I have write access to all the repositories so permissions should definitely not be an issue (plus I assume bamboo needs read-only access anyways).


Steps to reproduce:
- in your bitbucket account, follow a few projects/repositories
- try and change the source repositories in your bamboo on demand instance to a repo which you are following
fields.summary: (OnDemand) Bitbucket source repositories: repositories that I follow (and team-repositories too) are no longer selectable from repositories drop-down

fields.description:
*Step to replicate*
# Create two variables *passworder* and *Passworder* (notice p with caps)
# Run a customize build overridden the contents of the field
# While the fields remains hidden in the metadata as expected, the variable with capital P has it values revealed in the build summary see screenshot revealed.jpg
# However, if the build is run as customized but with the values not changed, the fields remained hidden

I believe the class com.atlassian.bamboo.util.PasswordMaskingUtils should be Masked
fields.summary: Customized variables whose values are hidden passwords are unmasked revealing the password in the build summary

fields.description:
The functionality in Bamboo to provide automatic dependency management for supported executables only currently works with Maven.

It would be very useful to extend this functionality to support Ant build scripts that use an ivy.xml file which lists dependencies. This would need to be implemented as a new Task, so could be made available as a new plugin. 

Nothing is available on the Marketplace at the moment that does this.
fields.summary: New Ivy Dependencies Processor task

fields.description:
Latest code in repo is not used when I click "Rerun all failed jobs". It does in fact perform a checkout from the remote repository but it checks out an old revision. I'm using Mercurial as my repository.

*Initial checkout:*
simple	08-Jan-2013 20:59:54	Starting task 'JavaClient' of type 'com.atlassian.bamboo.plugins.vcs:task.vcs.checkout'
simple	08-Jan-2013 20:59:54	Updating source code to revision: *061b5b313595dac3b0061ddcf7bbb76568d3cb7d*

*Re-run failures checkout:*
simple	08-Jan-2013 21:06:05	Starting task 'JavaClient' of type 'com.atlassian.bamboo.plugins.vcs:task.vcs.checkout'
simple	08-Jan-2013 21:06:05	Updating source code to revision: *061b5b313595dac3b0061ddcf7bbb76568d3cb7d*

My expectation of this feature was to allow someone to fix a code check-in but maybe it's strictly for working past intermittent failures? If that's the case then I would like this converted into a feature request to add an option for checking out the latest code.
fields.summary: Run only the jobs that have failed in the last build with the most recent source
